summary: The first encounter the Ghost Crew has with Darth Vader. I rather enjoyed it because they managed to show Vader as a powerful...
caption:
The first encounter the Ghost Crew has with Darth Vader. I rather enjoyed it because they managed to show Vader as a powerful presence and foe that could quite easily kill them all without letting that happen. Namely due to how the Sith become from all that hatred and anger residing in them that they enjoy watching people cower instead of finishing them off as quickly as possible.

It also did well as showing Vaders style being much more robotic than it used to be as Anakin due to the cybernetics and prosthetics.  His motions are still precise just much less fluid, with a stiffness to them.

All in all it did well as showcasing him as a foe that was WELL beyond Kanan and Ezra’s ability to even challenge.

summary: Just re-watched The Last Jedi (I’ve been up since like 6am, because we live on the farthest edge of town and to get to work...
body:
Just re-watched The Last Jedi (I’ve been up since like 6am, because we live on the farthest edge of town and to get to work requires at least a 45 minute commute, so my body says “Up early to get showered, dressed, eat breakfast, and have a coffee and a smoke, almost like you’re a responsible adult now” and I can’t get it to stop) and I stand by my previous review of it, with one caveat: It’s in a three-way tie with Empire and Rogue One as my favourite Star Wars film.

Highlights from my initial review that bear repeating:

The Good: Everything about Luke’s character makes perfect sense after the garbage fire of a plot that JJ Abrams gave him in The Force Awakens. Self-exile to a monoclime planet and snarky teaching methods a la Yoda? Check. Super ready to fall to the Dark Side in order to Win, but pulls himself back at the last second because if you win by being evil you actually lose? Check. Cosplaying Han Solo as a space-wizard laser-samurai in order to teach his nephew a lesson? Big check.

Jedi Master General Space Goddess Leia Organa is the greatest character put to film in this series, and I wish we could have seen her make Kylo Ren cry and blubber and apologise for being a shitty son.

Also, re: Carrie, I cry, still.

Kylo Ren is the Anti-Luke, who goes happily to the Dark Side, refuses to go back to the Light, and does the wrong things happily. (I’m not saying he was wrong to react to Luke’s presence the way he did, but he sure as fuck was wrong to do…basically everything he’s done since, despite being offered outs by everyone he’s ever encountered)

Also, dat Rashomon homage.

The Resistance acting like an actual military and telling Poe that he’s a dipshit who wasted 60+ lives for no discernible reason but his ego. I’m particularly proud of this bit:

(Actually, let’s divert for a sec - if Poe were commanding at Hoth, and not Leia, the Rebellion would have died in the snow. It would have been a last stand worthy of a thousand songs, with X-Wings and Speeders, completely drained of tibanna for their cannons, desperately crashing into AT-ATs, and pockets of soldiers selling every inch of ice so dearly that the Empire would have had to re-dye their boots because the blood wouldn’t come out, but it would have been a crushing defeat nonetheless, because Heroes Don’t Retreat.)

The Bad: Kylo Ren is too much ever.

The Ugly: Space Monaco is still 15 minutes too long.

title: Kathleen Kennedy Contract Extension
body:
Kathleen Kennedy has received a three year extension on her contract which shows that Disney believes that she is still the best bet for Star Wars to be successful in the future after a couple missteps according to fans.

https://screenrant.com/kathleen-kennedy-lucasfilm-contract-extension/

tags: should I tag this with the ship names
I'm feeling dangerous on this last day of September
summary: friendly reminder that having more than one ship is normal fandom behavior, and believing that your ship is real when canon...
body:
friendly reminder that having more than one ship is normal fandom behavior, and believing that your ship is real when canon doesn’t confirm it, or that your ship MUST BECOME REAL in canon is not normal behavior and you should stop being abusive to people who ship other ships in normal ways.

- signed, a Star Wars fan since 1990.

reblog.comment:
friendly reminder that having more than one ship is normal fandom behavior, and believing that your ship is real when canon doesn’t confirm it, or that your ship MUST BECOME REAL in canon is not normal behavior and you should stop being abusive to people who ship other ships in normal ways.

- signed, a Star Wars fan since 1990.

trail.content_raw:
friendly reminder that having more than one ship is normal fandom behavior, and believing that your ship is real when canon doesn’t confirm it, or that your ship MUST BECOME REAL in canon is not normal behavior and you should stop being abusive to people who ship other ships in normal ways.

- signed, a Star Wars fan since 1990.

friendly reminder that having more than one ship is normal fandom behavior, and believing that your ship is real when canon doesn’t confirm it, or that your ship MUST BECOME REAL in canon is not normal behavior and you should stop being abusive to people who ship other ships in normal ways.

- signed, a Star Wars fan since 1990.

summary:
Plourr Ilo: I don’t start no trouble. I mind my own business.
Wedge Antilles: Plourr, going up to a traffic cop who’s writing...
body:
Plourr Ilo: I don’t start no trouble. I mind my own business.
Wedge Antilles: Plourr, going up to a traffic cop who’s writing out a ticket for your X-Wing, and eating the citation right in front of his face absolutely falls under starting trouble.

dialogue.name: Plourr Ilo
dialogue.label: Plourr Ilo:
dialogue.phrase: I don’t start no trouble. I mind my own business.

dialogue.name: Wedge Antilles
dialogue.label: Wedge Antilles:
dialogue.phrase: Plourr, going up to a traffic cop who’s writing out a ticket for your X-Wing, and eating the citation right in front of his face absolutely falls under starting trouble.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

summary: The Possible Lives of Jyn Erso
title: The Possible Lives of Jyn Erso
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2xMwk0S

by RapidashPatronus

Words: 1567, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: Major Character Death
  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: Jyn Erso, Mon Mothma
  • Additional Tags: Essays, Diary/Journal, Canon Compliant, I love writing as Mon Motha, Who needs one word when eighteen verbose alternatives will perform a similar function, my sesquipedalian queen


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2xMwk0S

Ben and Sabé are starting their journey together and can’t agree on anything. It would be a constant battle if Ben had the will to fight.
